# OVTrack 论文阅读笔记

> Li S, Fischer T, Ke L, et al. Ovtrack: Open-vocabulary multiple object tracking[C]//Proceedings of the IEEE/CVF conference on computer vision and pattern recognition. 2023: 5567-5577.

## 1.Introduction

识别、定位和跟踪场景中动态物体的能力是许多现实世界应用的基础，比如自动驾驶和机器人系统。然而，传统的多对象跟踪(MOT)基准测试仅依赖于少数对象类别，这些类别几乎不能代表现实世界中遇到的大量可能对象。这使得当代MOT方法局限于一小组预定义的对象类别。本文通过解决一个新的任务来解决这一限制，开放词汇表MOT，旨在评估超出预定义训练类别的跟踪。我们进一步开发了OVTrack，这是一个开放词汇表跟踪器，能够跟踪任意对象类。它的设计基于两个关键要素:第一，利用视觉语言模型通过知识蒸馏进行分类和关联;其次，基于去噪扩散概率模型的鲁棒外观特征学习的数据幻觉策略。其结果是一个数据效率极高的开放词汇表跟踪器，它在仅对静态图像进行训练的情况下，在大规模、大词汇表TAO基准上设置了新的技术水平。

## 2.Method

At training time, we train a tracker $M$ on the training data distribution $D^\mathrm{train}=\{\mathbf{X}^\mathrm{train},\mathcal{A}^\mathrm{train}\}$ that contains video sequences $\mathbf{X}^\mathrm{train}$ and their respective annotations $A^\mathrm{train}$ of objects with semantic categories $C^\mathrm{base}\subset \mathbb{N} .$ Each annotation $\alpha\in\mathcal{A}^{\mathrm{train}}$ consists of a set of states $\{\alpha_t\}_{t\in T}$ for each frame $t\in T$ that the object is visible in. A state $\alpha_t=(\mathbf{b}_t,c_t)$ comprises the object class $c\in\mathbb{N}$ and the 2D bounding box $\mathbf{b}=[x,y,w,h]$, where $(x,y)$ is the center location in pixel coordinates and $(w,h)$ are width and height, respectively. At test time, we are given video sequences $\mathbf{X}^\mathrm{test}$ and a set of object classes $C^\mathrm{novel}\subset \mathbb{N} \setminus C^\mathrm{base}$ that we are interested in We aim to find all tracks $T$ of objects in $\mathbf{X}^\mathrm{test}$ belonging to classes $C^\mathrm{base}\cup C^\mathrm{novel}$. Each track state $\tau_t=(\mathbf{b}_t,p_t,c_t)\in\mathcal{T}$ contains predicted object confidence $p\in[0,1]$, class $c\in\mathbb{N}$ and 2D bounding box $\mathbf{b}=[x,y,w,h].$ The important diss tinctions to closed-set tracking are two-fold: 1) We evaluate the tracker $M$ not only on $C^\mathrm{base}$ but also on $C^\mathrm{novel}$ with $C^{\mathrm{novel}} \cap{C^{\mathrm{base}}}$ While $C^\mathrm{novel}$ is known at test time, our setup requires the tracker $M$ to track arbitrary object classes $c\in\mathbb{N}$ since $C^\mathrm{novel}$ remains unknown $at$ training time. In particular, the evaluation of $C^\mathrm{novel}$ illustrates the ability of tracker $M$ to track $an$y unknown class $c\in \mathbb{N} \setminus C^\mathrm{base}$, while the classes in $C^\mathrm{novel}$ serve $as\:proxy.$
